  "Allegations" : "12/20/1999 PAYMENT MADE FOR LIFE POLICY, CLIENT WANTED TO PROTECT HER COMPANY IN THE EVENT OF PREMATURE DEATH, INVESTED IN A VARIABLE LIFE POLICY AND DID NOT KEEP UP PREMIUM PAYMENTS AS OUTLINED IN THE POLICY ILLUSTRATION THAT SHE SIGNED.",

  "Broker Comment" : "ON MARCH 22, 2007 [CUSTOMER] WROTE TO THE SECURITIES DIVISION OF THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS IN REFERENCE TO A KANSAS CITY LIFE POLICY.I RESPONDED TO THE STATE THAT THE CLIENT PURCHASED THE POLICY FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUSINESS PLANNING.  AT THE TIME OF THE SALE ALL REPRESENTATION OF HER CURRENT SITUATION WERE ACCURATE AND THE POLICY WAS INLINE WITH HER GOALS AND DESIRES."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLAIMANT ALLEGES THAT WHILE UNDER MY SUPERVISION [BROKER] AND [BROKER] TRANSFERRED HER ACCOUNT FROM A FIXED ANNUITY PRODUCT TO A VARIABLE ANNUITY FOR NO ASCERTAINABLE PURPOSE OTHER THAN TO OBTAIN COMMISSIONS. [BROKER] AND [BROKER] DENIES THESE ALLEGATIONS AND STATES THAT THESE RECOMMENDATIONS WERE BASED ON A FULL AND FAIR ASSESSMENT OF THE CLIENTS NEEDS AND OBJECTIVES.
